publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3652 Chris Ballance: Cultural Commisssion—That the Parliament supports the First Minister’s desire, referred to in a speech on St Andrew’s Day, 2003, to "make the development of our creative drive, our imagination, the next major enterprise for our society" and endorses the conclusion of the Scottish Executive’s Cultural Commission’s final report that, in order to secure the First Minister’s vision, cultural funding should rise by £100m to 1% of the Executive’s annual budget.
S2M-3652 Cultural Commisssion (lodged on 29 November 2005) Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Patrick Harvie*

S2M-3652 Chris Ballance: Cultural Commisssion—That the Parliament supports the First Minister’s desire, referred to in a speech on St Andrew’s Day, 2003, to "make the development of our creative drive, our imagination, the next major enterprise for our society" and endorses the conclusion of the Scottish Executive’s Cultural Commission’s final report that, in order to secure the First Minister’s vision, cultural funding should rise by £100m to 1% of the Executive’s annual budget. Supported by: Carolyn Leckie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Patrick Harvie, Mark Ballard*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-3652 Cultural Commisssion (lodged on 29 November 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3652 Cultural Commisssion (lodged on 29 November 2005) Mike Pringle*
S2M-3652 Cultural Commisssion (lodged on 29 November 2005) Rosie Kane*
